etymologies: mid 19th century (a dialect word denoting a snail shell, with which the game, or a form of it, was originally played): perhaps from conch, but associated with (and frequently spelled) conquer in the 19th and early 20th centuries: an alternative name was conquerors

definitions: the hard, shiny dark brown nut of a horse chestnut tree.
shortDefinitions: hard, shiny dark brown nut of horse chestnut tree

definitions: a children's game in which each child has a conker on the end of a string and takes turns trying to break another's with it.
shortDefinitions: children's game in which each has conker on end of string and takes turns in trying to break another's with it
